data.title: Tried twice and still not impressed
data.text: Based on the reviews I thought I would try this and was almost made ill by the food.  I ordered the Rainbow Rice for takeout and ended up throwing most of it away.  The meat was tough and the rice had a "slimy" feel.  Since I've been in the area on business for a month, I decided to try them again, this time dining in the restaurant, and while much better than my first experience, this was still sub-standard Chinese food.  Would not recommend.

data.title: Second to None, and the Best
data.text: Great food, great services , totally a great restaurant, the owner are super and the food is great, luv the environment

data.title: Local Treasure Best Chinese food
data.text: Taiwan Dragon has been around for maaaaany years. The owner Mr. Jackson has captured the memories of Fort Hood and it great commanders. The restaurant is surrounded by thousands of pictures of famous army commander while the served in hood. The food is awesome is especially during lunch their staff is awesome and fast. The have a few local favorite dishes like the "Rainbow Rice" a beautiful mound of fried rice smothered in meats and veggies it a different take on a house fried rice. My other favorite is the 3 flavored soup. Let me just say if your ever under the weather or feel like a complete reboot this delicious bowl of soup will fix any ailment you have. Did I mention that it is huge? Made with chicken broth and contains Chicken, Beef, Shrimp, carrots, cabbage, broccoli, bamboo shoots and ancient Chinese secret. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu plus it's a pretty cool spot to visit Mr. Jackson may approach you with his laser pointer and show you important people he has hosted. Tell him Rick Acosta sent you. Enjoy

data.title: Amazing food and atmosphere
data.text: Great food! Great service! The owner came out and showed us pictures of all the famous commanders who had eaten there over the last 20 years.

data.title: Best in Killeen
data.text: Rainbow rice extra meat and extra shrimp made spicy! I'm in heaven. I eat this at least once sometimes twice a week. There's nothing like it anywhere else..A must have dish.

data.title: Great lunch specials too!
data.text: This is a family favorite. My ONLY negative is they aren't open on the weekends. My husband loves the generals chicken and I love the Kung Pao cabbage. The children love sweet and sour chicken and everyone enjoys the egg drop soup.

data.title: Luv luv and luv
data.text: This place has great food and great customer service. To go orders are always ready quickly. They do have funky hours and closed I believe on Monday's so always call ahead before you plan to eat there. Family friendly environment. I have been eating there for last.10 yrs.

data.title: Good food
data.text: I eat lunch here very often and enjoy the food and the environment.  Good variety of offerings to choose from fast friendly staff.  Service is fast and efficient.

data.title: They Have the Best Fried Rice in the World!!!
data.text: If you are from Killeen or have been in Killeen then you know about this little gem! If you like fried rice then you'll love Taiwan Dragon's "Rainbow Rice"....yes folk it have everything in it from chicken to seafood. This place is hands down the best fried rice not just in this city or state but the world!! It's so flavorful and feeds 2 or 3 for under 10 bucks. So go treat yourself i'm sure you deserve it!!

data.title: Outstanding!
data.text: Great food and great owner! We enjoyed looking at all of the pictures and storie from Mr. Jackson. A must visit while visiting Killeen!

data.title: Best Chinese in town!
data.text: The decor may be a little dated but this Chinese food is the best u can find in Killeen. They make everything fresh, and because it's not buffet, u can really tell that it was made for u. The only downfall...they're not open on the weekends.

data.title: Best Rainbow Rice
data.text: The food is always good and the staff friendly and helpful.The atmosphere reflects pictures of people who have enjoyed meeting and eating there.

data.title: Excellent food, good price
data.text: I usually do the carry out but have dined in. The food is great and the staff very pleasant, friendly, and courteous. The best Asian al a carte restaurant in this area in my opinion.

data.title: Great and Plentiful Food
data.text: On my first trip to Fort Hood my son took us to this "local legend".  Food was great and in large portions.  Service was good and prices reasonable.  Good menu, lots of variety. Parking a little sparse, but there are some businesses near by that close at night with good parking. Look forward to returning.

data.title: Quality Chinese Food
data.text: When our thirst for quality Chinese food has to be satisfied we turn to Taiwan Dragon.  Jackson cooks only the best.  My wife ordered Beef Szechuan and I ordered Three Delight.  The meats and vegetables are served steaming hot and fresh to your table.  Oh course no Chinese meal would be complete without Sweet and Sour or Eggs Drop soups and an Egg Roll.  Great place with great service!

data.title: Boring! Not Impressed.
data.text: Read all the rave reviews. But it Didn't hold up to the hype. All the pictures on the wall shows how long the place has been in business but the service was just ok. The Food was just ok. Definitely WON'T go back even if somebody else paid for it.

data.title: Great Food
data.text:
My wife is from Taiwan. We stop by every few weeks and eat at the Taiwan Dragon.
The food is very good every time we have been. I will continue to enjoy eating here regularly.

data.title: Excellent Food in a Great Environment
data.text: What an outstanding find.  Considering the large size if our group, close to thirty folks, the service was quick and the food was phenomenal.  If you leave Taiwan Dragon hungry it is your fault not the restaurants.  Our servers were attentive without being intrusive and the owner came over and pointed out members of our group and other friends who had been there before on the photo covered walls, and I mean photo covered.  This is a must if you are in the Killeen area.

data.title: Best Asian food
data.text: The owners will always remember you and make you feel like you're  they're favorite customer.  Their cashew/almond chicken is wonderful.  Their chicken wings are delicious.  My son loves to order the appetizers for 2. It comes out in a flaming dish.

data.title: Jackson is the Show!
data.text: Food was good to very good. The orange and pungent chicken got rave reviews, as did the General Tso chicken. The sesame chicken and shrimp entree were good. Unfortunately, the crispy duck was less than crispy, although the duck was tasty. The fried rice was good but not remarkable. What we really enjoyed was the host, Mr. Jackson, who provided us with a one man tour of his incredible photo collection on the walls of the restaurant. Service was good. What we enjoyed most was the opportunity to be together in a very friendly and welcoming place with good food overall.
